channel.title: Huge Chemical Plant Explosion < 1 mile from my parents house!
channel.description:
Their whole house shook last night and they felt the first large explosion and then multiple smaller ones afterwards. They could see flames shoot 100ft up in the air, and thick black smoke was heading towards their house. 15 or 20 miles away, at mine and srt8's house we saw the flash through the window that we though was heat lightning or something, but then we got the call from my parents. They had to come over here and spend the night on an air mattress because no one knew if the fumes were toxic or not.
Here is good picture of the explosion: [img]http://alt.coxnewsweb.com/cnishared/tools/shared/mediahub/08/48/06/slideshow_1064886_ddn050409fireweb20.jpg[/img] here are many more: http://projects.daytondailynews.com/cache/galleries/News/Local/050409wcexplosion/
Here are all of the stories about it so far: http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/dayton-news/road-near-explosion-site-reopens-105894.html http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/dayton-news/west-carrollton-blast-damaged-neighboring-houses-106110.html http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/dayton-news/veolia-starts-its-own-investigation-into-cause-of-explosion-106215.html http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/ohio-news/ohio-epa-to-probe-cause-of-plant-explosion-106415.html

item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:15, topic:277175”]Anyone is the UK remember the Hemel Hempstead fire?
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/4517962.stm

The smoke spread ~50 miles.

[/quote]

That is a brilliant picture.

item.title: Huge Chemical Plant Explosion < 1 mile from my parents house!
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

I thought chemical plants have learned over time to put way more work into extra security measures so things like this don’t happen anymore, considering all the incidents that have happened in the past.

item.title: Huge Chemical Plant Explosion < 1 mile from my parents house!
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

About 10 years ago a petrol station down the road blew up, similar shaking. Obviously not on that scale!!
Glad you’re ok

item.title: Huge Chemical Plant Explosion < 1 mile from my parents house!
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Chassy13:

I bet that scared the hell out of them.

I think that would scare the hell out of anyone keeping in mind the time that the explosion took place.

Read full topic
item.source: Huge Chemical Plant Explosion < 1 mile from my parents house!

item.title: Huge Chemical Plant Explosion < 1 mile from my parents house!
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Nerice, post:7, topic:277175”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=365832.msg2775564#msg2775564 date=1241492472]
i didnt know there are plants that can explode? or were they creating some sort of explosive plant using chemicals and it backfired on them?
[/quote]

Lol, chemicals are explosive, especially with some of the process’s they go through when producing products. I come from south of Houston where there are many chemical plants, they have all almost had some sort of problem at one point in time. Also lived in Texas City, where a plant there almost destroyed the whole town and surrounding towns.[/quote]I’m assuming he was being retarded and was talking about a literal plant.

Read full topic
